title: LOL Forums: Some people don't learn the game by watching videos of other gamers.
body: I have found in trying to learn this game other players often say watch other play. And it doesn't work for me. The only I can learn is in game. Watching video for me is like watching a movie. It wouldn't help me become a better actor, by watching a great actor act. You have a base level skill. So, if you wonder why some people don't progress in this game that's why. Their are multiple ways to learn anything. I wish people on this board would learn that.

You also won't get better unless you know what your flaws are and go into games with the specific goal in mind of not making one of those mistakes in particular until you've eventually fixed all the mistakes you know about.

Just playing the game without a goal in mind will at best only increase your ability to fluidly combo or to cs, not your actual overall mechanics are game sense.

Simply watching other players play will not teach you how to be a better player. You need to analyze the player's actions, try and understand why the player did what they did, and see how you can apply it to your own game.

Understanding what is going on is crucial to getting better at anything, whether you are watching others play, viewing guides from higher level players, or even reviewing what you do and how you do it. Practice makes perfect, but understanding what happens also goes a long way to help get better at the game.

I would agree that just watching high ELO players isn't necessarily the most effective thing to do for improvement, but a lot of streamers will explain their decision making process as they play or make guides to help understand what you should be focusing on.

To your example, just watching a movie won't make you a better actor, but watching behind the scenes clips and interviews can give you insight into how you should approach different roles and scenarios.

You should watch videos/streamers for the main purpose of knowing what to do and when to do it. Like for example....one of the biggest things that sets a high elo player apart from a low elo player is knowing when to give up and walk away. Knowing when its ok to tower dive for a kill, knowing when to stop chasing for a kill, knowing when to recall if your low on health instead of being greedy and sticking around. I cant tell you how many countless times i see greed be the main factor for poor decision making with lower elo players. I have 2 accounts, one in Gold 5 and one in Gold 1....and i still see it even in Gold. Lower elo's only want to play team deathmatch. People get greedy, so instead of making the smart decision and just walking away, recalling, or letting it go...they chase across the map for kills, stay in lane too long at low health, or greedily walk around the enemy jungle hunting for kills and getting themseleves killed. I only use this arguement b\c i learned how to hold myself back from doing these things by watching streamers and videos. Just saying that EVERYONE can learn from watching others. It just depends on what you're looking for or what you pay attention to when you watch
